title: ectophylla_alba
body:
Ectophylla Alba is a small white bat native to Central America and small parts of Caribbean that make make tents out of leaves (by nibbling at a part of the leaf to make it droop downward). They appear to look more like white puffballs with ears, their wings and feet being hidden.

title: m14_(upotte!!)
body:
Upotte's portrayal of the M14 rifle.

M14 is tall, blond has slightly puffy hair and like FAL, wears a tan blazer and long skirt.

M14 is brash, loud, lighthearted and friendly, though very competitive. She is also very fond of puns and silly firearms related jokes and references, which has become somewhat of a meme.

title: yamanaka_yukimori
body:
山中幸盛 (Yamanaka Yukimori), also known as 山中鹿介 (Yamanaka Shikanosuke, in the "kōdan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C5%8Ddan] stories written as 山中鹿之介), was a sengoku period samurai who served the "Amako clan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amako_clan].
He is sometimes called ”"Qilin's child":[http://tangorin.com/general/%E9%BA%92%E9%BA%9F%E5%85%90] of "San'in":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San'in_region]” or "the leader of "Amako's Ten Heroes":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%BC%E5%AD%90%E5%8D%81%E5%8B%87%E5%A3%AB]", and is best known for the legend of vowing to the moon in order to take on "seven troubles and eight agonies (idiom for "all kinds of troubles")" in exchange for the restoration of the Amako clan.

h4.Characters based on Yamanaka Yukimori/Shikanosuke

* [[yamanaka_shikanosuke_(sengoku_basara)|Yamanaka Shikanosuke]] ([[Sengoku Basara]])
* [[yamanaka_shikanosuke_(sengoku_musou)|Yamanaka Shikanosuke]] ([[Sengoku Musou]])
* [[yamanaka_shikanosuke_(taikou_risshiden)|Yamanaka Shikanosuke]] ([[Taikou Risshiden]])
* [[yamanaka_shikanosuke_(sengoku_taisen)|Yamanaka Shikanosuke]] ([[Sengoku Taisen]])
* [[yamanaka_shikanosuke_(ekiden_geksou_uchuujin)|Yamanaka Shikanosuke]] ([[Ekiden Geksou Uchuujin]])
* [[yamanaka_yukimori_(sengoku_bushouki_muramasa)|Yamanaka Yukimori]] ([[Sengoku Bushouki Muramasa]])

* [[Yamanaka Kojika]] ([[Sengoku Rance]])

* For other characters modeled after him, use its copyright name as the qualifier:
** "yamanaka_shikanosuke_*":[/tags?commit=Search&search%5bcategory%5d=4&search%5bhide_empty%5d=yes&search%5bname_matches%5d=yamanaka_shikanosuke_*]

title: sailor_dress
body:
Dresses that have most elements of sailor uniforms, such as a [[sailor collar]] or [[neckerchief]]. Sailor dresses may be depicted as a [[school uniform]] or casual wear.

Sailor dresses are distinct from [[serafuku]] in that they are a one-piece garment, whereas serafuku consist of a shirt and a skirt or shorts.

title: charlotte_cake
body:
A type of dessert or trifle that can be served hot or cold. It can also be known as an "ice-box cake". Bread, sponge cake or biscuits/cookies are used to line a mold, which is then filled with a fruit puree or custard. It can also be made using layers of breadcrumbs.

Classically, stale bread dipped in butter was used as the lining, but sponge cake or ladyfingers may be used today. The filling may be covered with a thin layer of similarly flavored gelatin.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: farsight_xr-20
body:
A weapon of [[grey alien|Maian]] design in the [[Nintendo 64]] game [[Perfect Dark]]. It is a long blue railgun with a roughly ovoid stock/barrel and a long muzzle with a diamond-shaped point. It reloads by absorbing "orbs" ammunition into the side of the barrel, includes a zoomable X-ray sight that can optionally follow potential targets, and fires laser pulses that can pierce walls out to seemingly infinite range and kill any target with one shot.

Info: http://perfectdark.retropixel.net/pd/weapons/#farsight

title: isaf
body:
[i]For "a real-world NATO-led security mission":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Security_Assistance_Force], use [[international_security_assistance_force|its full name]] as the tag.[/i]

The Independent State Allied Forces, the player's faction in the game [[Ace Combat 04]].

I.S.A.F. resembles the United Nations in its operation, formed of representatives from many smaller nations of the Usean continent that pool their resources in times of need.
During the Continental War, its military forces were nearly exterminated by the Erusians. Pushed back to a small island country called North Point, I.S.A.F. forces hunkered down to attempt to endure one final assault. This is where the player (as [[Mobius 1]]) comes in, and the events of the game begin. The military force ceased operations and disbanded after Mobius 1 deployed for Operation Katina; a follow up campaign that took place one year after the end of the The Usean Continental War, eliminating a remnant Eruseain faction called "Free Erusea". Which is found in the [[ace_combat_5]] arcade mode.

h4.See also

* "Acepedia article":http://acecombat.wikia.com/wiki/Independent_State_Allied_Forces
* [[Ace Combat 04]]
* [[Mobius 1]]

title: mike_z's_cat
body:
Minor character that appears in [[Skullgirls]] (as a random effect for one of [[Cerebella (Skullgirls)|Cerebella]]'s attacks) and [[Indivisible]] (as a hidden boss in the game's prototype).

Originally a rejected doodle for Skullgirls from a [[Lab Zero Games]] animator, it was noticed by LZ's lead programmer Mike "Mike Z" Zaimont, who insisted it appear in the game as an Easter egg. The development team allowed it, but only if Zaimont (who had no prior animation experience) animated the character himself.

title: e-2_hawkeye
body:
A military Airborne Early Warning and Control plane. The twin-turboprop Hawkeye serves the U.S Navy in the same role as the larger Boeing E-3 in the Airborne Warning and Control System, equipped with a 24-foot dorsal rotodome and communications equipment that enables it to surveil large areas and control aircraft within its assigned airspace. 

This aircraft is however, also used to defend carrier battle groups from enemy threats and thus it's endurance is better than that of the E-3.

title: x-36
body:
An American prototype jet fighter aircraft designed in 1997 to test the concept of airplanes without tail surfaces. The prototype was built to 28% the scale of a normal fighter jet and remotely controlled from a ground-based virtual cockpit; the second main innovation was a sophisticated fly-by-wire system capable of compensating the airplane's yaw and pitch instability. Two units were built and 31 flights were made, with the X-36 showing a very good handling in all of them; however, no further interest was shown in the concept, and the project was shelved. Both units are currently in display at military aviation museums in the United States.

The X-36 was featured in [[Ace Combat 3]]: Electrosphere as the XFA-36A Game, the most powerful regular airplane of the game, second only to the three unlockable airplanes.

Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McDonnell_Douglas_X-36

title: f-105_thunderchief
body:
A large [[jet]] fighter-bomber produced by the Republic Aviation Corporation in the 1950s. Originally armed with a nuclear weapon, it was adapted to carry conventional munitions and saw action in the Vietnam war. The two-seat F-105F and F-105G Wild Weasels were later developed to suppress enemy air defenses. 

The F-105 usually carried up to 6,400 kg (14,000 lb) of freefall bombs, plus AIM-9 Sidewinder AAMs or AGM-12 Bullpup air-to-surface missiles. It was also armed with a 20mm [[cannon]] on the port side of the nose.

h4. See also

* Wikipedia: "Republic F-105 Thunderchief":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_F-105_Thunderchief
* "Craig Baker's F-105 Site":http://www.burrusspta.org/thud.html

title: seijo_no_housei
body:
(Roar of artillery of the sacred woman)

[[Hayami Rasenjin]]'s short manga about Great Martyr [[st.barbara|Barbara]] at Heliopolis, who incarnated in a Russian monastery at the time of the Napoleonic Wars.

When the story was first published in Koudansha's Evening in 2013, the magazine's proofreaders "mistook":[https://twitter.com/mai_mai777/status/359526199220908033] "Огонь!" ("Fire!" in Russian) for "amigo!", and "”corrected”":[https://twitter.com/RASENJIN/status/359130238329950209] all the phrases in the manga.

Later it was published as a part of his 2015 comic book, "Rasenjin Douji Jouei":[http://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/4063546055/].

title: sashiromiya_sasha
body:
(さしろみや サーシャ)
"The shadow trainer becoming the lore of giants."

Originates from this video:
http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/nm7753348

Fan character from the [[Touhou]] series. Has the ability to manipulate shadows. Before the release of [[Touhou Hisoutensoku]], she was a certain [[niconico]] user's idea of the last boss. (Note: her creator is not a VIPPER)
She always wears a [[yukata]] and [[geta]]. She has [[blue hair]] and antler-like twin [[ahoge]].
Her species is "Daidarabocchi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daidarabocchi , a type of gigantic youkai in Japanese mythology. In fact, her size is the same as humans. She projects shadows on the fog and creates huge figures.
The title of the BGM for her stage is "Fake History of Black and Shadow - The Fake with High Quality"

h4.See Also

* "Touhou Wiki article on Sasha Sashiromiya":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Fan-made_characters/Sasha_Sashiromiya

title: gratin
body:
Gratin (French pronunciation: ​[ɡʁatɛ̃]) is a widespread culinary technique in which an ingredient is topped with a browned crust, often using breadcrumbs, grated cheese, egg and/or butter. Gratin originated in French cuisine and is usually prepared in a shallow dish of some kind. A gratin is baked or cooked under an overhead grill or broiler to form a golden crust on top and is traditionally served in its baking dish. A gratin dish refers to the shallow oven-proof container traditionally used to prepare gratins and similar dishes.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gratin

title: tomoe_gozen
body:
Tomoe Gozen (巴 御前) (born circa 1157, died in 1247), is a female japanese historical character. She was a late twelfth-century female samurai warrior (onna bugeisha), known for her bravery and strength. She is believed to have fought in and survived the Genpei War (1180–1185).

According to the historical account "The Tale of the Heike":
"Tomoe was especially beautiful, with white skin, long hair, and charming features. She was also a remarkably strong archer, and as a swordswoman she was a warrior worth a thousand, ready to confront a demon or a god, mounted or on foot. She handled unbroken horses with superb skill; she rode unscathed down perilous descents. Whenever a battle was imminent, Yoshinaka sent her out as his first captain, equipped with strong armor, an oversized sword, and a mighty bow; and she performed more deeds of valor than any of his other warriors."

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomoe_Gozen]

title: qantas
body:
An Australian airline originally established as [b]Q[/b]ueensland [b]A[/b]nd [b]N[/b]orthern [b]T[/b]erritory [b]A[/b]erial [b]S[/b]ervices in 1920, making it one of the oldest airlines still operating today. Nicknamed "The Flying Kangaroo," Qantas is the "flag carrier":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_carrier of Australia and its planes carry the distinctive company [[logo]] of a white [[kangaroo]] on a red background.

The 1988 film [i]Rain Man[/i] gave Qantas a strong worldwide reputation as an airline which has never had a single plane crash, even though "that's not entirely true":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qantas#Aircraft_incidents_and_accidents.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qantas

title: caveirao
body:
An armored personnel carrier in service of the Special Operations Battalion of the police of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The "Caveirão":http://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caveir%C3%A3o, whose name literally means "big skull", comes from its operator's symbol: a skull and a knife.

It is a black vehicle similar to a big van with a static turret-like superstructure. Despite its threatening appearance, it carries no weapons. Its purpose is solely to safely transport policemen to and from high-intensity urban conflicts.

title: dr._strangelove
body:
[b]Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb[/b], commonly known as [b]Dr. Strangelove[/b], is a 1964 black comedy film which satirizes the nuclear scare from that era. 

It was directed, produced, and co-written by [[Stanley Kubrick]], starring [[Peter Sellers]] and George C. Scott, and featuring Sterling Hayden, Keenan Wynn, and Slim Pickens. The film is loosely based on Peter George's Cold War thriller novel [i]Red Alert[/i] (also known as [i]Two Hours to Doom[/i]).

title: kabe_don
body:
A romance trope wherein an aggressive romantic partner slams one hand into the wall in front of the target of his affections as they walk past. This keeps the target from walking away without backing up, and more importantly, puts the two of them within each other's personal space, face to face.

The name comes from combining the Japanese [i]kabe[/i] (wall) and [i]don[/i] (the banging sound effect made when something slams into a solid object). "Wall-bang" is not a good English translation per se, however, because it could imply that sexual acts are taking place, or that something is being thrown out in disgust (i.e. books being thrown across the room and against the wall).

title: beatrice_castiglioni
body:
[b]Major spoilers below.[/b]

Character from [[Umineko no Koro no Kami]]. Also referred to as "Bīce" (BEE-chee).

[spoiler][[ushiromiya_kinzou|Kinzo Ushiromiya]]'s one and only lover. Her father was an Italian army official, and she accompanied him on a secret mission for the Salo Republic involving the transportation of 10 tons of gold. Traveling by submarine, the crew hit a mine and (with many casualities, including Beatrice's father) were barely able to take refuge on a small Japanese military base on Rokkenjima, where Kinzo was stationed.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]By speaking to each other, Kinzo and Beatrice dearly understood their respective sympathies and fell in love. On Rokkenjima, the Japanese and Italian armies proceeded to slaughter each other over the gold that the Italians transported, with Kinzo and Beatrice being the sole survivors. Beatrice was hurt in the crossfire, and was brought to [[nanjou_terumasa|Terumasa Nanjo]] by Kinzo to be treated. Afterwards, they started a secret relationship on Rokkenjima (due to Kinzo being married already) and eventually produced a child. Beatrice died during childbirth, and Kinzo named the child "[[ushiromiya_beatrice|Beatrice Ushiromiya]]" in her honor.[/spoiler]
other_names: ベアトリーチェ・カスティリオーニ

title: equilibrium
body: [b]Equilibrium[/b], known in Japan as [i]Rebellion[/i], is a dystopian [[science fiction]]/[[cyberpunk]] action movie directed by Kurt Wimmer about a future society that has outlawed human emotion in an effort to avert another disastrous war, and uses harsh tactics against those who refuse to take the emotion-deadening drug called Prozium. The movie is noted for introducing [[gunkata]], the deadly firearm-based [[martial arts]] practiced by the future society's ultimate enforcers, the [[Grammaton Cleric|Grammaton Clerics]], which has since been used in many anime and games.

title: hanten_(clothes)
body:
A traditional Japanese jacket/half coat. What's referred to as a hanten these days is a "wataire (stuffed) hanten" which is stuffed with cotton, mostly worn inside to protect yourself from the cold. It is worn by both men and women.
A dotera, also known as a tanzen, is a long, gown style winter garment with a low hemline, but it is often mixed up with a hanten.

A type of unstuffed jacket, that was called a shirushi-banten (印半纏, "hanten with an emblem"), is effectively the same as what is usually called a [[happi]] in the present day. There are small stylistic differences, but these were lost for the most part in the late Edo period.

h4.See also

title: akashi_school_uniform_company
body:
Akashi School Uniform Company (sometimes shortened to Akashi S.U.C.) is a Japanese company that manufactures and sells school uniforms.


h4. Promotional Characters

On November 18, 2015, Akashi SUC announced a promotional campaign based around characters designed by [[Misaki Kurehito]].
The 3D models of the characters were created by ISAO and programmed by MasatakaP (まさたかP). 
Music and lyrics were done by buzzG.


h6. Characters
* [[Fujisaka Shion]]
* [[Hokaze Aoi]]
* [[Kagura Komachi]]

h6. Links
* "Official site":http://www.pri-sta.jp
* Video: "PRキャラクター発表会　明石S.U.C.　手話で会社紹介":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CYCcTgNHQzk   (PR Character Presentation - Company Profile in Sign Language)
** Hokaze Aoi talks about Akashi S.U.C.  She uses sign language and the video also includes subtitles.
* Video: "明石S.U.C PRキャラクター発表会 Japanese school uniform company 'Akashi S.U.C' PV":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8GRN3WyX_8o]
** A 30 second clip of Hokaze Aoi singing.
* Video: "KSBスーパーJチャンネル PRキャラクター発表会　明石S.U.C. in秋葉原UDX":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Uh6ipi4A-k (KSB Super J Channel PR Character Presentation - Akashi S.U.C. in Akihabara UDX)
** A short segment talking about and showing the promotional characters.  Includes an interview with [[Kanemoto Hisako]], the seiyuu for Hokaze Aoi. 



h4. Links

* "Official company page":http://www.akashi-suc.jp/
* "Wikipedia entry (Japanese)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明石被服興業

title: hachijou_ikuko
body:
[b]Major spoilers below.[/b]

Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]].

A reclusive writer, and lover, of mystery novels. She may or may not be a projected version of [[Featherine Augustus Aurora]].

[spoiler]Ikuko finds an amnesiac [[Ushiromiya Battler|Battler Ushiromiya]] on the side of the road, following the murders on Rokkenjima. She renames him [[Hachijou Tooya|Tohya Hachijo]], due to him only remembering the fact that he was 18 years old upon being discovered. After learning about [[yasu_(umineko)|Sayo Yasuda]]'s forgeries, she ghost wrote novels based on Tooya's attempts to remember the Rokkenjima murders. These novels then became the framing device for Episodes 3 through 6.[/spoiler]

title: persona_q:_shadow_of_the_labyrinth
body: Persona Q: Shadow of the Labyrinth (ペルソナQ シャドウ オブ ザ ラビリンス) is a role-playing video game developed and published by [[Atlus]] for the Nintendo 3DS. It is a spinoff of the Persona series, combining characters and elements from both [[Persona 3]] and [[Persona 4]], with gameplay elements from the [[Sekaiju no Meikyuu]] series.

title: kanojo_x_kanojo_x_kanojo
body:
[b]Kanojo × Kanojo × Kanojo: San Shimai to no Dokidoki Kyoudou Seikatsu[/b] (彼女×彼女×彼女～三姉妹とのドキドキ共同生活～) is an eroge visual novel by Crossnet, first released 2008.

The main title has also been romanized as [i]Kanojyo × Kanojyo × Kanojyo[/i].

Further products in the series include:

* a 2009 sequel game, entitled [i]Kanojo × Kanojo × Kanojo: Dokidoki Full Throttle![/i] (彼女×彼女×彼女　ドキドキフルスロットル！);
* a 2009 OVA by Milky Animation Label, entitled [i]Kanojo × Kanojo × Kanojo: San Shimai to no Dokidoki Kyoudou Seikatsu[/i] like the original game.

h4. Characters

* [[byakudan_midori|Byakudan Midori]]

* [[honnouji_tsukasa|Honnouji Tsukasa]]

* [[orifushi_mafuyu|Orifushi Mafuyu]]

title: peony_(flower)
body:
Long used as an ornamental and medicinal plant, the peony has large, showy flowers, often scented. The plant itself comes in herbaceous, treelike, and hybrid forms. It is named after Paeon, a student of Asclepius, the Greek god of medicine and healing.

h4. See also

* Wikipedia: "Peony":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peony

title: kotonomiya_yuki
body:
Character from the adult visual novel [[Suigetsu]]. Like castmate [[Yamato Suzuran]], she's a fan favorite of [[Futaba Channel]]'s Nijiura board.
 
Several derivative characters exist based on her. The most common are: 

* [[Yuki-san]] - Looks like the actual Yuki, but is almost always portrayed laughing maniacally.
* [[Yami Yuki]] - Dark Yuki. Has no hair ribbons or neckerchief. Sometimes seen in black/purple outfit.
* [[Chibi Yami]] - Small, most commonly seen with a long black cat creature.
* [[Kiri-san]] - Long hair, glasses, red hair ribbons.
* [[Yukiko-san]] - Short hair, glasses, green hair ribbons.

body: Críet Trédís is a female character from [[Lotte no Omocha!]].  She is a mixed race [[elf]] (half-álfur and half-nótt álfur), which commonly results in mottled patterns of areas of light skin (from álfur heritage) over dark skin (from nótt álfur heritage).  In Críet's case it has resulted in a natural [[one-piece tan|one-piece swimsuit tanline]]-like skin pattern.

title: heart_roidmude
body:
A commander of Roidmudes, the antagonists of [[kamen_rider_drive_(series)|Kamen Rider Drive]]. He has a red body and huge [[horns]].
For his human form, use [[Heart_(kamen_rider_drive)]] tag.

[spoilers]
For his previous state, use [[Roidmudes 002]], [[Spider-Type Roidmude]] or the both tags.
[/spoilers]

h4.See also

* "Kamen Rider Wikia":http://kamenrider.wikia.com/wiki/Heart

title: mezul
body:
One of the five Greeed monsters of [[Kamen Rider OOO (series)|Kamen Rider OOO]].

She is the creator of the Aquatic Animal Yummies and the mastermind behind them. She also provides the Orca (Shachi), Eel (Unagi), and Octopus (Tako) [[O Medal|Core Medals]], hence the reason her model is based on the medals' fusion: [[ShaUTa (OOO combo)|Shauta]].

Her human form is played by Miki Honoka, while her Greeed Form is voiced by [[Yukana]].

body:
Arcade / X68000 ver. title: "チェルノブ" or "Atomic Runner CHELNOV 戦う人間発電所"
Mega Drive / Genesis / Virtual Console ver. title: CHELNOV (チェルノブ)

A 1988 side-scrolling video game by [[Data East]](Deco). The [[chelnov_(character)|titular hero]] also appeared in Deco's "Trio The Punch" and "Fighter's History: Mizoguchi Kiki Ippatsu!!"
